item.title: How the search for Nancy Guthrie played out as police detain a person for questioning
item.description: As the frantic search for the mother of a well-known US journalist enters its 12th day, police have more questions than answers. Here's how it unfolded.

item.title: Bondi: Path to Terror
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Australian fans miss out on World Cup tickets as prices skyrocket
item.description: A host of Australian fans will be denied the chance to watch the Socceroos World Cup campaign amid accusations of price gouging by FIFA as tickets to the tournament soar to astronomical prices.

item.title: Chinese flotilla sailed to edge of Australia's waters, ADF chief reveals at Senate estimates
item.description: Under questioning in Senate estimates, the chief of the Australian Defence Force reveals that a Chinese flotilla sailed within seven nautical miles of Australia's 200 nautical mile exclusive economic zone.

item.title: NSW Parliament backs Cheryl Grimmer's family after 56-year quest for justice
item.description: Decades after three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer vanished from Fairy Meadow Beach, NSW MPs move to support her family's fight for justice, as Jeremy Buckingham directly addressed the alleged perpetrator under parliamentary privilege.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Channel Nine says Warren Tredrea has now paid costs over long-running legal battle
item.description: Channel Nine has confirmed it has received legal costs from former AFL player and sports presenter Warren Tredrea, who was ordered to pay $149,000 to his ex-employer.

item.title: More homes in Daly River damaged by flooding, with water levels expected to recede from Thursday
item.description: Floodwaters have spilled inside "quite a number of homes" in the remote Northern Territory town of Daly River, authorities say, with still-rising water levels delaying the return home for evacuated locals.

item.title: PM condemns 'white supremacy ideology' behind alleged Invasion Day terror attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has condemned the "racism and hatred" and "white supremacy ideology" behind the alleged terrorist attack on the Invasion Day rally in Borloo/Perth last month.

item.title: El Paso flights resume after US anti-drone system prompts sudden shutdown
item.description: A secret military laser-based anti-drone system prompted the Trump administration to ban air traffic for more than seven hours in and out of the Texas border city of El Paso.

item.title: Australia Diamonds defeat Jamaica 80-33 in third netball Test to claim 3-0 series win
item.description: Coach Stacey Marinkovich believes a refreshed Diamonds squad has found its "identity" ahead of attempting to become the first Australian netball team to defend Commonwealth Games gold.

item.title: Possible El Niño within months raising potential for hot, dry year across Australia
item.description: The first El Niño in three years could develop during the coming months, raising the possibility of worsening drought and extreme heat across Australia in 2026.

item.title: Lando Norris quickest on day one of F1 preseason test, Oscar Piastri drives well and Max Verstappen impresses
item.description: McLaren's Formula 1 world champion Lando Norris was fastest on the first day of preseason testing in Bahrain, but Max Verstappen and Red Bull caught the attention with pace and plenty of laps.

item.title: Baker Boy talks new album Djandjay, Riverboats festival and family legacy
item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.description: The American actor was best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003.

item.description: Most Australians want greater social cohesion here, even if they don't see much of it right now.

item.title: Future of Port Hedland's West End uncertain after buyback scheme ends
item.description: As Port Hedland's controversial dust buyback scheme winds up, Pilbara Ports quietly walks away from major plans to build a training facility and accommodation, with development plans for the area still uncertain.

item.title: Protesters march through Melbourne's CBD as Israeli President Isaac Herzog concludes visit
item.description: Thousands of people have marched through Melbourne's CBD in protest as Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to the Australia winds up.

item.title: South Africa beats Afghanistan at Twenty20 World Cup after two super overs at Narendra Modi Stadium
item.description: South Africa wins the most dramatic T20 World Cup group stage clash with Afghanistan, featuring two super overs and countless twists of fortune.

item.description: The man detained for questioning in the investigation into the disappearance of a US TV show host's mother has been released and the search continues.

item.title: Tasmanian man Corey Chugg found alive four days after going missing in bushland
item.description: The 32-year-old man went into a bushland with a friend to collect firewood on Sunday. Police say he has been found alive at the bottom of a steep incline.

item.title: Julian Assange's brother backs exiled former ASIO spy Marcus amid Bondi Beach gunman radicalisation claims
item.description: Former undercover agent Marcus says he shared intelligence with ASIO about Bondi gunmen Naveed and Sajid Akram's alleged terrorism associations as far back as 2019.

item.description: The mother of a young boy killed in a house fire in 2017 has given emotional evidence at an inquest into his death.

item.description: Staff at the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit will be implementing recommended changes to their workplace culture following an independent review.

item.title: Italy wins first T20 Cricket World Cup match as Australian-born players shine in 10-wicket win over Nepal
item.description: Sydney-born brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca have guided T20 World Cup debutants Italy to their first win in the tournament, as their unbeaten half-centuries secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over Nepal on Thursday.

item.title: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors gather for apology anniversary
item.description: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors have gathered in Canberra for the apology anniversary. The government is pledging new money to help them heal.

item.description: Four-time Formula 1 world champion Max Verstappen says the 2026 cars are "not so fun", claiming the increasing energy management demands on drivers are "just not Formula 1".

item.title: Albany Woollen Mills' 101 years celebrated via shared love of blankets
item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.description: From the trial of Erin Patterson to the landslide election victory, 2025 is pilloried in this year's satirical art prize, the Bald Archy.

item.description: A man engulfed in flames is captured on CCTV after an arson attack at a Hunter Valley business.

item.title: Suspicious fire at Thornton business
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bushfire threatens properties in central Victoria, with rising heat to be followed by gusty storms
item.description: The fire at Trawool, south of Seymour, broke out near the Goulburn Valley Highway in central Victoria on a day when half the state was facing extreme fire danger.

item.title: Western Australia's demersal fishing ban hits hard in coastal tourist town of Kalbarri
item.description: People in the coastal tourist town of Kalbarri say they are already suffering the effects of WA's demersal fishing ban, less than two months after it came into force.

item.title: Police inspect outhouse, water tank in renewed search for Gus Lamont
item.description: SA police said they have inspected an outhouse where cement has recently been laid and a water tank as part of the latest search for Gus Lamont in South Australia's Mid North, with no evidence so far.

item.title: Man accused of murdering Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics pleads guilty to burglary charge as trial begins
item.description: Lawyers for one of two men on trial for the 1999 murder of Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics tell the ACT Supreme Court he was just the lookout, and had nothing to do with her death.

item.title: Fire crews battle blaze south of Launceston
item.description: The Tasmania Fire Service has downgraded an emergency bushfire warning for an area south of Launceston, with helicopters and ground crews in attendance.

item.title: Mobil Oil Australia to pay $16m fine for misleading claims about fuel sold in Queensland
item.description: The ACCC said Mobil advertised its Mobil Synergy fuel but did not actually supply the product at the time.

item.title: Australian production company Matchbox Pictures to be closed by Universal International Studios
item.description: Matchbox Pictures, the local production house behind Dog Park, The Survivors and Secret City, will be closed by its international parent company, Universal International Studios.

item.title: Private health premiums to rise at fastest rate in almost a decade
item.description: Private health insurance premiums will rise at their fastest rate in almost a decade, after the federal government approved a 4.41 per cent average increase from April.

item.title: Police drop charges against WIM Resource employee accused of falsifying documents
item.description: Victoria Police has dropped all charges against WIM Resource employee Murray Wilson, who worked on the controversial Avonbank Mineral Sands Project.

item.title: Man charged over alleged terrorism act at Perth Invasion Day rally named
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sydney’s great fatberg hiding in the sewers
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: ABC to move Adelaide office to new Tapangka site in CBD, alongside arts organisations
item.description: The ABC has announced a new location for its Adelaide operations, moving to a new arts and media hub alongside other government arts organisation in the CBD.

item.title: Jail term increased for Roma man who stabbed police officer during call-out
item.description: A man who stabbed a police officer with a pair of scissors during a domestic violence call-out in regional Queensland has had his jail sentence increased.

item.title: Aussie teen forced to wait for Olympic final as heavy snow wreaks havoc
item.description: Australia's Ally Hickman has to wait another day for the women's snowboard slopestyle final, as a snowstorm hits Livigno and causes scheduling delays.

item.title: NSW man kept in custody for safety after allegedly 'squandering' $270k of drug-trade money
item.description: Peter John Howlett, who allegedly used a fishing trawler to import illicit drugs into Australia, is refused bail by Mackay magistrate concerned for his safety.

item.title: ASIC announces review into 'lead generators' pushing superannuation switching
item.description: ASIC is investigating whether lead generators are complying with their legal obligations when suggesting people switch their retirement savings into less-regulated investment schemes.

item.title: US military says 11 men killed in strikes on alleged drug smuggling boats
item.description: The strikes are the latest from the US on boats in the eastern Pacific Ocean and Caribbean Sea targeting what Donald Trump alleges are drug trafficking operations.

item.title: Richard Roxburgh, Damon Herriman and Toby Schmitz star in 'wickedly funny' play Art
item.description: In the 1994 French play Art, Serge spends 160,000 euros on an all-white painting, horrifying his friend Marc. It might just wreck their decades-long friendship.

item.title: Tasmanian salmon industry subject to stricter mortality reporting rules
item.description: Biosecurity Tasmania has introduced stricter requirements for Tasmania's salmon companies reporting on farmed fish deaths — but whether the public finds out is another matter.

item.title: Millionaire Gary Stevenson's dire warning for Australian property market losing the 'fair go'
item.description: British economist Gary Stevenson is on a speaking tour, warning Australia will follow the path of the UK with "poverty exploding" unless politicians deal with inequality.

item.title: Man who escaped health care facility charged with murder over Merrylands stabbing
item.description: A 25-year-old man police say stabbed a man to death in Merrylands days after fleeing from health authorities has been charged with murder.

item.title: Police to return to Oak Park 'frequently' in search for Gus Lamont
item.description: SA's Police Commissioner says officers will be returning to Oak Park station frequently in the coming months as they continue their investigation into the disappearance of Gus Lamont.

item.title: Hindmarsh Island bridge dispute told through Ngarrindjeri women's art
item.description: In the 1990s, a group of Indigenous women were accused of fabricating claims of sacred sites to stop the construction of a bridge south of Adelaide. It was a decision that has impacted a community for decades.

item.title: Bruce Highway cut by flooding at Proserpine as coast cops more than 300mm of rain in 24 hours
item.description: Parts of the Queensland coast have received more than 300 millimetres of rain in 24 hours, leading to road closures, including the Bruce Highway at Proserpine.

item.title: Trawool bushfire threat eases but authorities say blaze not yet under control
item.description: Authorities say weather conditions have helped fire crews battling a blaze that threatened homes near Trawool, south of Seymour.

item.title: Space industry firm Terram Astra launches with plans for outback Northern Territory, South Australia
item.description: A new company sets its sights on the Australian outback, with bold ambitions of creating a high-tech hub capable of communicating with outer space.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Jürgen Klopp makes Milano Cortina Games cameo, ice hockey fight ban labelled a 'joke' — quick hits from day 11
item.description: Football manager Jürgen Klopp makes an appearance at the Milano Cortina Games, while French ice hockey players are unhappy about the ban handed to a teammate for fighting. Here are the quick hits from day 11.

item.title: Health insurers surge ahead of premium hike, ASX rises — as it happened
item.description: Shares of health insurers have surged ahead of premium hikes while the ASX has started its day higher, and NAB has reported a 30 per cent jump in quarterly profit.

item.title: Parkes Shire Council formally opposes controversial waste incinerator
item.description: The Parkes Shire Council has formally objected to controversial plans to dispose of some of Sydney's red-bin rubbish on the edge of its biggest town.

item.title: Daly River flood evacuees threatened with edged weapon in incident outside Darwin evacuation centre
item.description: As Daly River flood evacuees near their second full week in Darwin, residents staying at the showgrounds say they feel scared after a group was threatened with an edged weapon on Monday morning.

item.title: Federal Court finds factional and 'oppressive' control in South West Aboriginal Medical Service
item.description: A federal court judge has found that two board members factionally controlled a South West Indigenous Medical Service and unfairly expelled members to avoid scrutiny and maintain control.

item.title: Sydney Writers' Festival announces Randa Abdel-Fattah for 2026 program
item.description: Sydney Writers' Festival has defended featuring Randa Abdel-Fattah on its 2026 program, saying it is "not in the business of cancelling or censoring writers".

item.title: Matt Wright moved to Darwin Correctional Centre's Complex Behavioural Unit
item.description: Matt Wright, the star of Netflix's Outback Wrangler, has been separated from the general prison population at the Darwin Correctional Centre where most inmates contend with overcrowding and extreme heat.

item.title: Foo Fighters announce 2026 Australian stadium tour
item.description: American rock superstars Foo Fighters will return to Australia for a run of stadium shows before the year is out.

item.title: Australia's most successful Winter Olympics coach Peter McNiel and how his moguls team led the Milano Cortina gold rush
item.description: With a background in mathematics and an enviable attention to detail, it would be tempting to think of Australian ski coach Peter McNiel as moguls' answer to Moneyball. The truth is far more detailed.

item.title: Police release man arrested over Galiwin'ku stabbing death without charge
item.description: Police say a 19-year-old man arrested over the stabbing death of another man, 27, on Elcho Island on Saturday has been released without charge "pending further investigations".

item.title: Qld Police seize $100,000 worth of illicit drugs at Airlie Beach
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: As Donald Trump's first Board of Peace meeting approaches, Indonesians are watching their own president closely
item.description: Ahead of the inaugural meeting of US President Donald Trump's Board of Peace, charged with leading the way forward in Gaza, Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto faces perhaps his most significant foreign policy test yet.

item.title: Is it ever a good idea to stay together for the kids?
item.description: When a relationships breaks down, sometimes we think staying in the familiar discomfort is less scary — and even protective — for our kids. But is it ever a good idea to stay in an unhappy relationship for the sake of the children?

item.title: James Slipper set to play 200th Super Rugby match as ACT Brumbies travel to face Crusaders in Christchurch
item.description: James Slipper will become the first Australian player to reach the 200-game milestone in Super Rugby.

item.title: Chalmers suggests ex-RBA governor's spending critique is due to personal vendetta
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Philip Lowe was critical of the government over spending because it did not re-appoint him as RBA governor.

item.title: Mazda, Nissan, Hyundai and Subaru face multi-million-dollar penalties under NVES
item.description: Major car brands are staring down the barrel of multi-million-dollar penalties for exceeding their emissions, the first results of the federal government's climate laws for new vehicles have revealed.

item.title: 'Thunderous applause' as vicarious liability laws pass Victoria's upper house
item.description: A bill reversing a High Court decision that found the Catholic Church could not be sued for the actions of a priest passes unopposed through Victoria's upper house.

item.title: Alcoa hit with record fine for illegally clearing WA jarrah forests for bauxite mine
item.description: US mining giant Alcoa is forced to pay $55 million after unlawfully clearing parts of a Western Australian native forest to mine bauxite.

item.title: Former Coles manager admits 'human error' over Shapes 'Down Down' pricing in federal court showdown
item.description: A former Coles manager has given evidence in the federal court on day three of a bombshell case between the consumer watchdog and supermarket giant.

item.title: Man blamed dog for baby's death at Queensland caravan park, court told
item.description: The man became frustrated with five-week-old's crying, violently shook him and threw him onto a couch, the court heard.

item.title: Footage shows gunman spraying bullets into suburban home
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australian citizen with ISIS links in Syria hit with exclusion order, federal government says
item.description: The federal government has temporarily banned an Australian citizen linked to ISIS fighters from returning home from Syria.

item.title: Solutions to stop people being radicalised raised at NSW inquiry into right-wing extremism
item.description: Prevention methods to tackle radicalisation are being discussed by experts at a New South Wales inquiry into measures to combat right-wing extremism.

item.title: Mechanic rescued after going missing in Queensland outback for almost a week
item.description: A man in his 40s has been rescued after going missing in outback Queensland for almost a week.

item.title: Sovereign citizen convicted of stalking, intimidating NSW police officer
item.description: A man who a court heard fell victim to an "explosion" of extremist views and misinformation has been convicted of stalking and intimidating a Hunter Valley police officer.

item.title: Victoria loses Australian MotoGP with 2026 race to be last in state
item.description: Victoria loses the rights to host the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix, ending a three-decade association with the event.

item.title: Ex-Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila fined $11k over A-League card fixing saga
item.description: Former Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila avoids jail time over his involvement in a card fixing scandal.

item.title: Navy chief's speech disrupted at Defence industry conference after rocks thrown through window
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Overnight rain at Kilto Station.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Blue Bush Floodway enjoyed by all.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 12
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Queensland man accused of offering $730 to adopt and abuse overseas children
item.description: A Queensland man accused of offering to pay more than $700 to adopt children overseas so he could have sex with them is refused bail.

item.title: Ex-cop granted bail over alleged stalking following neighbour dispute
item.description: A former Queensland police officer accused of allegedly wearing a balaclava and Easter bonnet to harass and intimidate a neighbouring family has been granted bail.

item.title: Man fined $30,000 for poaching rare snakes from Far North Queensland rainforest
item.description: The court heard Clinton Spiteri was with two others when he visited a rainforest in the Cape York area to steal eight snakes.

item.title: Two Doubleview house fires cause headaches for firefighters
item.description: Emergency services extinguish two separate house fires in close proximity to each other in Doubleview in Perth's north.

item.title: Live: Australia's Scott straight through to aerials final, Hickman up later in slopestyle final
item.description: Australia's Danielle Scott is through to the final of the women's aerials at Livigno, with Ally Hickman still to contest the women's slopestyle final on day 12 at the Winter Olympics. Follow live.

item.title: Should the ISIS brides be allowed to return to Australia?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Sisonke Msimang picked up what police said was an explosive device at Perth Invasion Day rally, she gave it to them and waited for a slow response
item.description: When Sisonke picked up the childlike looking device in Perth on Australia Day, she had a sense of foreboding so she took it to police. She says they took some time to act.

item.title: Driver charged over Camden fatal crash escaped Cumberland Hospital mental health care before incident
item.description: A driver charged over a double-fatal crash used a staff pass to escape hospital the day before an alleged Sydney stabber fled the same mental health facility.
